tweets.text: I am always the first to criticise the @EnvAgency but they have been fantastic the last 48hrs. Good comms and on banks sheeting and hopefully sandbagging! Thank You! @NRobinsonEA @EnvAgencyMids @simonfisherNFU

This @EnvAgency video provides you with some useful advice just in case you find yourself in a #flood situation #PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph You can also sign up for #flood alerts in your local area by clicking https://t.co/3j61SoqPlU #SafetyFirst #Yorkshire #NorthEast https://t.co/Yps90p2vqi

tweets.text:
More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

Heavy rain is forecast overnight and the risk of flooding remains across South #Yorkshire. 

Thank you to our emergency services, @EnvAgencyYNE, @YorkshireWater and our local council's who are working round the clock to keep us safe.

listening to @FinlayPringle at the #oceansrecovery conference during the #YouthVoicesForTheOcean session. Here is a great fact: apparently more people die eating #biscuits than by #sharks. So step away from the tin and leave those sharks alone! #Oceanhero @JNCC_UK @WWF @EnvAgency https://t.co/Mjwaedtv4C

tweets.text:
We have #floodalerts and #floodwarnings in place across the North West. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/fiXvaBOMbi

üåß Flood alert in force üåß

‚ö†Ô∏è The Met Office has issued a warning for heavy rain until noon on Thursday

üëÇ Sign up for flood warnings & keep up to date at https://t.co/ebgxo6Gijc, call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 , and follow @EnvAgencyNW #floodaware

Making a journey this week? Please do not drive through #flood water. Check your route before you travel: https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine. #StormChristoph  #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/di6rCwoPtZ

tweets.text:
Here's @stewart_mounsey a Flood Risk Manager at #TeamEA with an update and advice ahead of potential flooding this week

Prepare now for #StormChristoph and sign up for flood warnings in your area here https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/4dola2dANt

#FloodWarnings are in force across England as a result of #StormChristoph. #TeamEA have been working 24/7 to keep our communities safe. Stay safe at home and find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/X4IQl3fUIh  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/EkLRcEMncE

My latest stop today was at #Croston #Lancashire where I found Amber & Lynn from @EnvAgencyNW field teams overseeing the operation of our #flood storage basin. #incidents #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Ap9yeq1xTW

Our flood forecast shows the areas at risk of flooding over the next 5 days. Take action now - check your flood risk and sign up to our flood warning service for the latest info:  https://t.co/6jAgryn4Al #floodaware https://t.co/l5nqRpmidI

Thanks to @EnvAgencyMids' @DaveThroupEA for the update on flood barriers being erected in Bewdley.
For flood risk management advice click this link:  
https://t.co/wsV2Z9wO94 https://t.co/PR320G6MIK

tweets.text: @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Not sure it can be fully blaimed on upland management.  Around here gullies are never cleared so they are unable to catch silt hence silting of watercourses and the drainage cannot operate as designed.
@AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @K_Fletcher_MP May I ask what are they doing please?

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

#esiStateOfTheArt talk on 25 Jan by @dr_anne_leonard 
https://t.co/nxxTzyEUiU

https://t.co/dwauHlCe4j #ExeterAMR @sascampaigns @ECEHH @ExeterMed @EnvAgency @WHO @ellen_husain @ExeterMicrobes @ExeterMarine @BBCRadio4 @ExeterMedTruro @WillHGaze @Ruth_Garside #AntibioticResistance

urls.title: Amber ‚Äì Goddess of Flood Warnings
urls.description: Almost all religious texts, mythologies and folklores tell of a great apocalyptic flood, early on in the history of civilisation. It may be the only thing that all legends, and the archaeological e‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
As #StormChristoph
rolls in I am making my offerings to Amber Goddess of Flood Warnings just in case. Stay safe everyone! https://t.co/OgRmY2pMQX https://t.co/0W6avfRmJa

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils Unlikely. Courts are in crisis. Huge backlog. EA just talking, cajoling, with little effect. It is grim. All over pastoral lowlands. I report but EA officers restricted to quiet chats. Now there's a planning moratorium across 80% of Mendip District. And THIS is why. https://t.co/S6kNItJiGJ

tweets.text: @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts We don't actually have robust evidence to link burning to flooding - most is on eroding/bare peat. Moreover, we also don't know yet what rewetted, completely saturated peatlands do under such conditions (where will water go)? Very important questions to really find answers to.

tweets.text:
Flood alerts are in place for parts of South Yorks. As a precaution Rotherham Council is taking steps to protect high-risk residential areas.

Make sure you are prepared in the event of flooding and follow @EnvAgency & @EnvAgencyYNE for updates

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/EUSqZinZO1 https://t.co/3ZlF0nZets

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware

tweets.text:
Plans are in place for potential flooding incidents in Northwich over the next few days: https://t.co/AJlXlmmDT7

Follow @EnvAgencyNW and sign up to receive flood alerts and warnings at: https://t.co/lEDfKdIQld #FloodAware #StormChristoph https://t.co/LizhbO6OD8

Good to see new dredging of the River Parrett underway between Northmoor & M5. Thanks @IDBsomerset for the pic below & for organising this water injection dredging with @TeamVanOord. Thanks also @EnvAgencySW @NESouthWest. The river level's stayed up well & forecast rain will help https://t.co/vGQTqDyHkE

Can #beavers help reduce the peak of #flooding? 

@LancasterUni hydrologist, and @britishhydrosoc President, Dr Nick Chappell is finding out by measuring how beavers are diverting water onto a flood plain. #NFM
Read the story: üì∞https://t.co/UXIr1EmkuX

üì∑ C. Scrimgeour, H. Devey https://t.co/KeXzKyG6XL

tweets.text: @jamiehyde1978 @EnvAgencyNW @tmbc_places @tmbc_highways @tmbc_chiefexec Hi Jamie. I can confirm that Haughton Green is visited by our mechanical sweepers/cleansing teams every 6 weeks. It is next due on Monday 15 February and then every 6 weeks, so the March visit will be Monday 29th. Can you DM your street name so I can double-check this please?
Heavy rain is expected from #StormChristoph tomorrow - as always sign up to our flood warning service Stay #floodaware https://t.co/xE8Rupk4ct https://t.co/oo3py0fuT1
